page.title: 06St. Peter's Church
page.content: It is uncertain whether the church was originally dedicated to St. Peter or St. Bartholomew when it was built in the late 11th. century. The walls were built from the bricks and flint from a nearby Roman villa. It is derelict now and in a very bad state of disrepair. The last burial in the now overgrown churchyard was thought to be in 1938, and until the summer of 1982 occasional services were held there. It is said that there were some witches buried in the churchyard and there is a tombstone at the north end of the church with the inscription "HERE THE WICKED CEASE FROM TROUBLING AND THE WEARY ARE AT REST".
